verses.verse: Then the Lord <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Moses, <S%H4872><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"This <S%H2088><s%> shall be the law <S%H8451><s%> of the leper <S%H6879><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of his cleansing. <S%H2893><s%> Now he shall be brought <S%H935><s%> to the priest, <S%H3548><s%>

and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall go <S%H3318><s%> out to the outside <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2351><s%> of the camp. <S%H4264><s%> Thus the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall look, <S%H7200><s%> and if <S%H2009><s%> the infection <S%H5061><s%> of leprosy <S%H6883><s%> has been healed <S%H7495><s%> in the leper, <S%H6879><s%>

then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall give <S%H6680><s%> orders <S%H6680><s%> to take <S%H3947><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> live <S%H2416><s%> clean <S%H2889><s%> birds <S%H6833><s%> and cedar <S%H730><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%> and a scarlet <S%H8144><s%> string <S%H9641><s%> and hyssop <S%H231><s%> for the one who is to be cleansed. <S%H2891><s%>

"The priest <S%H3548><s%> shall also give <S%H6680><s%> orders <S%H6680><s%> to slay <S%H7819><s%> the one <S%H259><s%> bird <S%H6833><s%> in an earthenware <S%H2789><s%> vessel <S%H3627><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> running <S%H2416><s%> water. <S%H4325><s%>

"[As for] the live <S%H2416><s%> bird, <S%H6833><s%> he shall take <S%H3947><s%> it, together with the cedar <S%H730><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%> and the scarlet <S%H8144><s%> string <S%H9641><s%> and the hyssop, <S%H231><s%> and shall dip <S%H2881><s%> them and the live <S%H2416><s%> bird <S%H6833><s%> in the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the bird <S%H6833><s%> that was slain <S%H7819><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the running <S%H2416><s%> water. <S%H4325><s%>

"He shall then sprinkle <S%H5137><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> times <S%H6471><s%> the one who is to be cleansed <S%H2891><s%> from the leprosy, <S%H6883><s%> and shall pronounce <S%H2891><s%> him clean, <S%H2891><s%> and shall let the live <S%H2416><s%> bird <S%H6833><s%> go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H7971><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the open <S%H6440><s%> field. <S%H7704><s%>

"The one to be cleansed <S%H2891><s%> shall then wash <S%H3526><s%> his clothes <S%H899><s%> and shave <S%H1548><s%> off <S%H1548><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his hair, <S%H8181><s%> and bathe <S%H7364><s%> in water <S%H4325><s%> and be clean. <S%H2891><s%> Now afterward, <S%H310><s%> he may enter <S%H935><s%> the camp, <S%H4264><s%> but he shall stay <S%H3427><s%> outside <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2351><s%> his tent <S%H168><s%> for seven <S%H7651><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

"And it will be on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> that he shall shave <S%H1548><s%> off <S%H1548><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his hair: <S%H8181><s%> he shall shave <S%H1548><s%> his head <S%H7218><s%> and his beard <S%H2206><s%> and his eyebrows, <S%H5869><s%> <S%H1354><s%> even all <S%H3605><s%> his hair. <S%H8181><s%> He shall then wash <S%H3526><s%> his clothes <S%H899><s%> and bathe <S%H7364><s%> his body <S%H1320><s%> in water <S%H4325><s%> and be clean. <S%H2891><s%>

"Now on the eighth <S%H8066><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> he is to take <S%H3947><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> male <S%H3532><s%> lambs <S%H3532><s%> without <S%H8549><s%> defect, <S%H8549><s%> and a yearling <S%H8141><s%> ewe <S%H3535><s%> lamb <S%H3535><s%> without <S%H8549><s%> defect, <S%H8549><s%> and three-tenths [of an ephah] of fine <S%H5560><s%> flour <S%H5560><s%> mixed <S%H1101><s%> with oil <S%H8081><s%> for a grain offering, <S%H4503><s%> and one <S%H259><s%> log <S%H3849><s%> of oil; <S%H8081><s%>

and the priest <S%H3548><s%> who pronounces <S%H2891><s%> him clean <S%H2891><s%> shall present <S%H5975><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> to be cleansed <S%H2891><s%> and the aforesaid before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> at the doorway <S%H6607><s%> of the tent <S%H168><s%> of meeting. <S%H4150><s%>

"Then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall take <S%H3947><s%> the one <S%H259><s%> male <S%H3532><s%> lamb <S%H3532><s%> and bring <S%H7126><s%> it for a guilt <S%H817><s%> offering, <S%H817><s%> with the log <S%H3849><s%> of oil, <S%H8081><s%> and present <S%H5130><s%> them as a wave <S%H8573><s%> offering <S%H8573><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

"Next he shall slaughter <S%H7819><s%> the male <S%H3532><s%> lamb <S%H3532><s%> in the place <S%H4725><s%> where <S%H834><s%> they slaughter <S%H7819><s%> the sin <S%H9128><s%> offering <S%H9128><s%> and the burnt <S%H5930><s%> offering, <S%H5930><s%> at the place <S%H4725><s%> of the sanctuary <S%H6944><s%> – for the guilt <S%H817><s%> offering, <S%H817><s%> like the sin <S%H9128><s%> offering, <S%H9128><s%> belongs to the priest; <S%H3548><s%> it is most <S%H6944><s%> holy. <S%H6944><s%>

"The priest <S%H3548><s%> shall then take <S%H3947><s%> some <S%H4480><s%> of the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the guilt <S%H817><s%> offering, <S%H817><s%> and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall put <S%H5414><s%> [it] on the lobe <S%H8571><s%> of the right <S%H3233><s%> ear <S%H241><s%> of the one to be cleansed, <S%H2891><s%> and on the thumb <S%H931><s%> of his right <S%H3233><s%> hand, <S%H3027><s%> and on the big <S%H931><s%> toe <S%H931><s%> of his right <S%H3233><s%> foot. <S%H7272><s%>
"The priest <S%H3548><s%> shall also take <S%H3947><s%> some <S%H4480><s%> of the log <S%H3849><s%> of oil, <S%H8081><s%> and pour <S%H3332><s%> [it] into his left <S%H8042><s%> palm; <S%H3709><s%>

the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall then dip <S%H2881><s%> his right-hand finger <S%H676><s%> into the oil <S%H8081><s%> that is in his left <S%H8042><s%> palm, <S%H3709><s%> and with his finger <S%H676><s%> sprinkle <S%H5137><s%> some <S%H4480><s%> of the oil <S%H8081><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> times <S%H6471><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

"And of the remaining <S%H3499><s%> oil <S%H8081><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is in his palm, <S%H3709><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall put <S%H5414><s%> some on the right <S%H3233><s%> ear <S%H241><s%> lobe <S%H8571><s%> of the one to be cleansed, <S%H2891><s%> and on the thumb <S%H931><s%> of his right <S%H3233><s%> hand, <S%H3027><s%> and on the big <S%H931><s%> toe <S%H931><s%> of his right <S%H3233><s%> foot, <S%H7272><s%> on the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the guilt <S%H817><s%> offering; <S%H817><s%>

while the rest <S%H3498><s%> of the oil <S%H8081><s%> that is in the priest <S%H3548><s%>'s palm, <S%H3709><s%> he shall put <S%H5414><s%> on the head <S%H7218><s%> of the one to be cleansed. <S%H2891><s%> So the priest shall make <S%H3722><s%> atonement <S%H3722><s%> on his behalf <S%H5921><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

"The priest <S%H3548><s%> shall next offer <S%H6213><s%> the sin <S%H9128><s%> offering <S%H9128><s%> and make <S%H3722><s%> atonement <S%H3722><s%> for the one to be cleansed <S%H2891><s%> from his uncleanness. <S%H2932><s%> Then afterward, <S%H310><s%> he shall slaughter <S%H7819><s%> the burnt <S%H5930><s%> offering. <S%H5930><s%>

"And the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall offer <S%H5927><s%> up the burnt <S%H5930><s%> offering <S%H5930><s%> and the grain offering <S%H4503><s%> on the altar. <S%H4196><s%> Thus the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make <S%H3722><s%> atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him, and he shall be clean. <S%H2891><s%>

"But if <S%H518><s%> he is poor, <S%H1800><s%> and his means <S%H3027><s%> are insufficient, <S%H5381><s%> then he is to take <S%H3947><s%> one <S%H259><s%> male <S%H3532><s%> lamb <S%H3532><s%> for a guilt <S%H817><s%> offering <S%H817><s%> as a wave <S%H8573><s%> offering <S%H8573><s%> to make <S%H3722><s%> atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him, and one-tenth [of an ephah] of fine <S%H5560><s%> flour <S%H5560><s%> mixed <S%H1101><s%> with oil <S%H8081><s%> for a grain offering, <S%H4503><s%> and a log <S%H3849><s%> of oil, <S%H8081><s%>

and two <S%H8147><s%> turtledoves <S%H8449><s%> or <S%H176><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H1121><s%> pigeons <S%H3123><s%> which <S%H834><s%> are within <S%H5381><s%> his means, <S%H3027><s%> the one <S%H259><s%> shall be a sin <S%H9128><s%> offering <S%H9128><s%> and the other <S%H259><s%> a burnt <S%H5930><s%> offering. <S%H5930><s%>

"Then the eighth <S%H8066><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> he shall bring <S%H935><s%> them for his cleansing <S%H2893><s%> to the priest, <S%H3548><s%> at the doorway <S%H6607><s%> of the tent <S%H168><s%> of meeting, <S%H4150><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

"And the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall take <S%H3947><s%> the lamb <S%H3532><s%> of the guilt <S%H817><s%> offering, <S%H817><s%> and the log <S%H3849><s%> of oil, <S%H8081><s%> and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall offer <S%H5130><s%> them for a wave <S%H8573><s%> offering <S%H8573><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

"Next he shall slaughter <S%H7819><s%> the lamb <S%H3532><s%> of the guilt <S%H817><s%> offering; <S%H817><s%> and the priest <S%H3548><s%> is to take <S%H3947><s%> some <S%H4480><s%> of the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the guilt <S%H817><s%> offering <S%H817><s%> and put <S%H5414><s%> [it] on the lobe <S%H8571><s%> of the right <S%H3233><s%> ear <S%H241><s%> of the one to be cleansed <S%H2891><s%> and on the thumb <S%H931><s%> of his right <S%H3233><s%> hand, <S%H3027><s%> and on the big <S%H931><s%> toe <S%H931><s%> of his right <S%H3233><s%> foot. <S%H7272><s%>
"The priest <S%H3548><s%> shall also pour <S%H3332><s%> some <S%H4480><s%> of the oil <S%H8081><s%> into his left <S%H8042><s%> palm; <S%H3709><s%>

and with his right-hand finger <S%H676><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall sprinkle <S%H5137><s%> some <S%H4480><s%> of the oil <S%H8081><s%> that is in his left <S%H8042><s%> palm <S%H3709><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> times <S%H6471><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

"The priest <S%H3548><s%> shall then put <S%H5414><s%> some <S%H4480><s%> of the oil <S%H8081><s%> that is in his palm <S%H3709><s%> on the lobe <S%H8571><s%> of the right <S%H3233><s%> ear <S%H241><s%> of the one to be cleansed, <S%H2891><s%> and on the thumb <S%H931><s%> of his right <S%H3233><s%> hand, <S%H3027><s%> and on the big <S%H931><s%> toe <S%H931><s%> of his right <S%H3233><s%> foot, <S%H7272><s%> on the place <S%H4725><s%> of the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the guilt <S%H817><s%> offering. <S%H817><s%>

"Moreover, the rest <S%H3498><s%> of the oil <S%H8081><s%> that is in the priest's palm <S%H3709><s%> he shall put <S%H5414><s%> on the head <S%H7218><s%> of the one to be cleansed, <S%H2891><s%> to make <S%H3722><s%> atonement <S%H3722><s%> on his behalf <S%H5921><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

"He shall then offer <S%H6213><s%> one <S%H259><s%> of the turtledoves <S%H8449><s%> or <S%H176><s%> young <S%H1121><s%> pigeons, <S%H3123><s%> which <S%H834><s%> are within <S%H5381><s%> his means. <S%H3027><s%>

"[He shall offer] what <S%H834><s%> he can afford, <S%H5381><s%> <S%H3027><s%> the one <S%H259><s%> for a sin <S%H9128><s%> offering, <S%H9128><s%> and the other <S%H259><s%> for a burnt <S%H5930><s%> offering, <S%H5930><s%> together <S%H5921><s%> with the grain offering. <S%H4503><s%> So the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make <S%H3722><s%> atonement <S%H3722><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> on behalf <S%H5921><s%> of the one to be cleansed. <S%H2891><s%>

"This <S%H2088><s%> is the law <S%H8451><s%> [for him] in whom <S%H834><s%> there is an infection <S%H5061><s%> of leprosy, <S%H6883><s%> whose <S%H834><s%> means <S%H3027><s%> are limited <S%H5381><s%> for his cleansing. <S%H2893><s%>"
The Lord <S%H3068><s%> further spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Moses <S%H4872><s%> and to Aaron, <S%H175><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"When <S%H3588><s%> you enter <S%H935><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan, <S%H3667><s%> which <S%H834><s%> I give <S%H5414><s%> you for a possession, <S%H272><s%> and I put <S%H5414><s%> a mark <S%H5061><s%> of leprosy <S%H6883><s%> on a house <S%H1004><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of your possession, <S%H272><s%>

then the one who <S%H834><s%> owns the house <S%H1004><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> and tell <S%H5046><s%> the priest, <S%H3548><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> '[Something] like a mark <S%H5061><s%> [of leprosy] has become <S%H7200><s%> visible <S%H7200><s%> to me in the house. <S%H1004><s%>'

"The priest <S%H3548><s%> shall then order <S%H6680><s%> that they empty <S%H6437><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> before <S%H2962><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%> goes <S%H935><s%> in to look <S%H7200><s%> at the mark, <S%H5061><s%> so that everything <S%H3605><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> need not become <S%H2930><s%> unclean; <S%H2930><s%> and afterward <S%H310><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall go <S%H935><s%> in to look <S%H7200><s%> at the house. <S%H1004><s%>

"So he shall look <S%H7200><s%> at the mark, <S%H5061><s%> and if <S%H2009><s%> the mark <S%H5061><s%> on the walls <S%H7023><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> has greenish <S%H3422><s%> or <S%H176><s%> reddish <S%H125><s%> depressions, <S%H8258><s%> and appears <S%H4758><s%> deeper <S%H8217><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the surface; <S%H7023><s%>

then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall come <S%H3318><s%> out of the house, <S%H1004><s%> to the doorway, <S%H6607><s%> and quarantine <S%H5462><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> for seven <S%H7651><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

"And the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall return <S%H7725><s%> on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> and make <S%H7200><s%> an inspection. <S%H7200><s%> If <S%H2009><s%> the mark <S%H5061><s%> has indeed <S%H2009><s%> spread <S%H6581><s%> in the walls <S%H7023><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%>

then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall order <S%H6680><s%> them to tear <S%H2502><s%> out the stones <S%H68><s%> with the mark <S%H5061><s%> in them and throw <S%H7993><s%> them away <S%H7993><s%> at an unclean <S%H2931><s%> place <S%H4725><s%> outside <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2351><s%> the city. <S%H5892><s%>

"And he shall have the house <S%H1004><s%> scraped <S%H7106><s%> all <S%H5439><s%> around <S%H5439><s%> inside, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1004><s%> and they shall dump <S%H8210><s%> the plaster <S%H6083><s%> that they scrape <S%H7096><s%> off <S%H7096><s%> at an unclean <S%H2931><s%> place <S%H4725><s%> outside <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2351><s%> the city. <S%H5892><s%>

"Then they shall take <S%H3947><s%> other <S%H312><s%> stones <S%H68><s%> and replace <S%H8478><s%> <S%H935><s%> [those] stones; <S%H68><s%> and he shall take <S%H3947><s%> other <S%H312><s%> plaster <S%H6083><s%> and replaster <S%H2902><s%> the house. <S%H1004><s%>

"If, <S%H518><s%> however, the mark <S%H5061><s%> breaks <S%H9457><s%> out again <S%H7725><s%> in the house, <S%H1004><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he has torn <S%H2502><s%> out the stones <S%H68><s%> and scraped <S%H7096><s%> the house, <S%H1004><s%> and after <S%H310><s%> it has been replastered, <S%H2902><s%>

then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> in and make <S%H7200><s%> an inspection. <S%H7200><s%> If <S%H2009><s%> he sees <S%H2009><s%> that the mark <S%H5061><s%> has indeed <S%H2009><s%> spread <S%H6581><s%> in the house, <S%H1004><s%> it is a malignant <S%H3992><s%> mark <S%H6883><s%> in the house; <S%H1004><s%> it is unclean. <S%H2931><s%>

"He shall therefore tear <S%H5422><s%> down <S%H5422><s%> the house, <S%H1004><s%> its stones, <S%H68><s%> and its timbers, <S%H6086><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the plaster <S%H6083><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%> and he shall take <S%H3318><s%> [them] outside <S%H413><s%> <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2351><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> to an unclean <S%H2931><s%> place. <S%H4725><s%>

"Moreover, whoever goes <S%H935><s%> into the house <S%H1004><s%> during <S%H3605><s%> the time <S%H3117><s%> that he has quarantined <S%H5462><s%> it, becomes <S%H2930><s%> unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening. <S%H6153><s%>

"Likewise, whoever lies <S%H7901><s%> down <S%H7901><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> shall wash <S%H3526><s%> his clothes, <S%H899><s%> and whoever eats <S%H398><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> shall wash <S%H3526><s%> his clothes. <S%H899><s%>

"If, <S%H518><s%> on the other hand, the priest <S%H3548><s%> comes <S%H935><s%> in and makes <S%H7200><s%> an inspection, <S%H7200><s%> and the mark <S%H5061><s%> has not indeed <S%H2009><s%> spread <S%H6581><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> has been replastered, <S%H2902><s%> then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall pronounce <S%H2891><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> clean <S%H2891><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the mark <S%H5061><s%> has not reappeared. <S%H7495><s%>

"To cleanse <S%H2398><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> then, he shall take <S%H3947><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> birds <S%H6833><s%> and cedar <S%H730><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%> and a scarlet <S%H8144><s%> string <S%H9641><s%> and hyssop, <S%H231><s%>
and he shall slaughter <S%H7819><s%> the one <S%H259><s%> bird <S%H6833><s%> in an earthenware <S%H2789><s%> vessel <S%H3627><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> running <S%H2416><s%> water. <S%H4325><s%>

"Then he shall take <S%H3947><s%> the cedar <S%H730><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%> and the hyssop <S%H231><s%> and the scarlet <S%H8144><s%> string, <S%H9641><s%> with the live <S%H2416><s%> bird, <S%H6833><s%> and dip <S%H2881><s%> them in the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the slain <S%H7819><s%> bird, <S%H6833><s%> as well as in the running <S%H2416><s%> water, <S%H4325><s%> and sprinkle <S%H5137><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> times. <S%H6471><s%>

"He shall thus cleanse <S%H2398><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> with the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the bird <S%H6833><s%> and with the running <S%H2416><s%> water, <S%H4325><s%> along with the live <S%H2416><s%> bird <S%H6833><s%> and with the cedar <S%H730><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%> and with the hyssop <S%H231><s%> and with the scarlet <S%H8144><s%> string. <S%H9641><s%>

"However, he shall let the live <S%H2416><s%> bird <S%H6833><s%> go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H7971><s%> outside <S%H413><s%> <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2351><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> into the open <S%H6440><s%> field. <S%H7704><s%> So he shall make <S%H3722><s%> atonement <S%H3722><s%> for the house, <S%H1004><s%> and it shall be clean. <S%H2891><s%>"
This <S%H2088><s%> is the law <S%H8451><s%> for any <S%H3605><s%> mark <S%H5061><s%> of leprosy <S%H6883><s%> – even for a scale, <S%H5424><s%>
and for the leprous <S%H6883><s%> garment <S%H899><s%> or house, <S%H1004><s%>
and for a swelling, <S%H7613><s%> and for a scab, <S%H5597><s%> and for a bright <S%H934><s%> spot <S%H934><s%> –
to teach <S%H3384><s%> when <S%H3117><s%> they are unclean, <S%H2931><s%> and when <S%H3117><s%> they are clean. <S%H2889><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> is the law <S%H8451><s%> of leprosy. <S%H6883><s%>
